rows.business_item_short_description: The GPU was initially used to simulate human imagination, enabling the virtual worlds of video games and films.
rows.business_item_long_description: The GPU was initially used to simulate human imagination, enabling the virtual worlds of video games and films. Today, it also simulates human intelligence, enabling a deeper understanding of the physical world. Its parallel processing capabilities, supported by thousands of computing cores, are essential for deep learning algorithms.
rows.evidence_span: The GPU was initially used to simulate human imagination, enabling the virtual worlds of video games and films. Today, it also simulates human intelligence, enabling a deeper understanding of the physical world. Its parallel processing capabilities, supported by thousands of computing cores, are essential for deep learning algorithms.

rows.business_item_short_description: With our introduction of the CUDA programming model in 2006, we opened the parallel processing capabilities of our GPU to a broad range of compute-intensive applications.
rows.business_item_long_description: With our introduction of the CUDA programming model in 2006, we opened the parallel processing capabilities of our GPU to a broad range of compute-intensive applications, paving the way for new uses in modern computing.
rows.evidence_span: With our introduction of the CUDA programming model in 2006, we opened the parallel processing capabilities of our GPU to a broad range of compute-intensive applications, paving the way for

rows.business_item_short_description: Compute & Networking is a reportable segment with significant revenue growth.
rows.business_item_long_description: Compute & Networking is one of NVIDIA's reportable segments, showing a substantial increase in revenue year over year. For the year ended Jan 26, 2025, this segment generated $116,193 million, up from $47,405 million the previous year.

rows.business_item_short_description: Graphics is a reportable segment with revenue and operating income reported for the years ended Jan 26, 2025 and Jan 28, 2024.
rows.business_item_long_description: Graphics is one of NVIDIA's reportable segments. The segment generated $14,304 million in revenue for the year ended Jan 26, 2025, compared to $13,517 million in the prior year, representing a 6% increase. Operating income for the segment was $5,085 million in 2025, down from $5,846 million in 2024.
